intro: Trichostema purpusii, commonly known as the Purpus's bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white trichomes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Trichostema purpusii is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
